function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Differences in data sensitivity and sample size leading to varying percent changes in energy usage.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increase in home residency due to covid-19 pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Remote learning in public schools","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift in energy use behavior","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increase in household energy use due to prolonged time spent at home during the covid-19 pandemic.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Surge in covid-19 cases coinciding with an increase in non-hvac energy use during a specific period.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Non-weather normalized loads analysis increases the risk of incomplete understanding of load behavior across a day-long period, potentially leading to inaccurate conclusions.","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Comparison of energy consumption across income levels may reveal disparities in access to resources and energy usage patterns, with potential implications for public health and well-being.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Study of hvac and non-hvac loads across pandemic and pre-pandemic periods may provide insights into the impact of public health crises on indoor environmental quality and disease transmission in built environments.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate load characterization of non-hvac loads","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited comparison of hvac consumption across years","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited sample sizes for household income data analysis","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential outliers in household income data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incomplete data in housing unit records","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Data obtained from household survey may contain personal or sensitive information about occupants.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Close proximity and high density of occupants in housing units may lead to increased risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of temperature data to analyze hvac use may reveal patterns of occupant behavior and routines.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Regular data collection and monitoring of electricity use in housing units may lead to increased human contact in the built environment, potentially facilitating the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited monitoring of certain circuits due to the constraints of the home energy monitoring system may result in incomplete data collection, affecting the accuracy of energy use analysis.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Gathering data from multiple housing units in different states increases the risk of cross-contamination of infectious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Comparison of pre-pandemic and post-pandemic electricity use may overlook the potential impact of contagious diseases on energy consumption patterns.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Drawing conclusions about changes in energy use behavior without considering the influence of contagious diseases may lead to incomplete findings.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Covid-19 pandemic introducing unprecedented changes in residential building energy consumption.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased energy consumption due to changes in occupant behavior and usage of residential buildings during the pandemic.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on historical data and assumptions for building energy modeling may not accurately reflect current energy consumption patterns.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited information quantifying consumption variations by sector","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased use of electricity in the residential sector shifts additional energy costs to impacts of covid-19 on energy use of lighting and hvac loads in individual buildings, leading to uncertainty and potential inefficiencies in energy management strategies.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited ability for households using setback features to benefit from reduced heating and cooling energy use during unoccupied
